result.execSummary:
The defendant Philip J. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Philip J. Smith was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Philip J. Smith is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Philip J. Smith was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Philip J. Smith was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay $750.00 fine plus costs.  Bond to be applied to fine/costs.  Any bond remaining to be held until determination made regarding costs requested by State and restitution.
Defendant to pay restitution and surcharge if any ordered.  State to file request within 30 days and hearing to be scheduled if amount disputed.

Undergo a domestic abuse assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Comply with any conditions ordered by agent.

supervisions.notes: Bond to be applied to costs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Philip J. Smith
